required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Prospective Study to Evaluate AEs, Risk Factors and Drug Utilization of BUSCAPINA COMPOSITUM N in Adults From Metropolitan Lima
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Prospective Cohort Study to Evaluate the Incidence of Adverse Events (AE), Risk Factors, and Drug Utilization Patterns Related to Treatment With BUSCAPINA COMPOSITUM N From March to December 2016 in Patients From Metropolitan Lima

brief_summary.textblock: What AE occur in routine clinical practice, what is the incidence of AE and Adverse Drug Reaction, how many patients present with AE symptoms related to a potential liver injury. What are the drug utilization patterns in patients, what are the predisposing factors for the occurrence of adverse events and adverse drug reactions.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With an Incidence of Adverse Event (AE) Associated to Potential Liver Damage During the Clinical Evaluation of Patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with an incidence of Adverse Event (AE) associated to potential liver damage during the clinical evaluation of patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Different Transaminase Levels Found by the Doctor During the Clinical Evaluation of Patients With Symptoms Related to Potential Liver Damage.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with different transaminase levels found by the doctor during the clinical evaluation of patients with symptoms related to potential liver damage. No patient with symptoms related to potential liver damage was identified, thus analyses of transaminase levels was not performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Different Drug Utilization Patterns of Buscapina Compositum N in Patients in Metropolitan Lima
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with different drug utilization patterns of Buscapina Compositum N in patients in Metropolitan Lima.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Per Adverse Event Preferred Term in Patients Who Developed Any Adverse Event During Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients per adverse event preferred term in patients who developed any adverse event during treatment with Buscapina Compositum N.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Different Variables Related to the Occurrence of Increase of Transaminases in Patients Under Treatment With Buscapina Compositum N
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with different variables related to the occurrence of increase of transaminases in patients under treatment with Buscapina Compositum N in Metropolitan Lima. No patient with symptoms related to potential liver damage was identified, thus analyses of transaminase levels was not performed.

arm_group.description: Men with any type of gastrointestinal, hepato-biliary, urinary or genital spasmodic syndromes
Women with any type of gastrointestinal, hepato-biliary, urinary or genital spasmodic syndromes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients 18 years of age and older who have received at least one dose of BUSCAPINA COMPOSITUM N according to label indications and who attend to one of the pharmacies, clinics, or private doctors office selected for the study.
2. Patients who agree to adhere to the protocol procedures of this study.
3. Women who are not pregnant or breast feeding
4. Persons who sign the informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
1. Patients with allergy to BUSCAPINA COMPOSITUM N or any of the compounds in the formula.
2. Patients with mechanical stenosis of the gastrointestinal tract.
3. Patients with myasthenia gravis.
4. Patients with megacolon.
5. Patients breastfeeding at the time of enrollment or who have become pregnant during treatment with BUSCAPINA COMPOSITUM N.
6. Patients with clinical evidence of immunosuppression.
7. Patients with urinary retention subvesical obstruction (such as prostatic adenoma).
8. Patients with right-angle glaucoma.
9. Patients with tachycardia and tachyarrhythmia.
10. Patients with severe hepatic impairment.
11. Patients with psychiatric disorders.
12. Patients with alcohol dependence or drugs.
13. Patients who discontinue the protocol are not eligible for re-enrollment.
14. Researchers, company personnel or their relatives.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Observational prospective study to evaluate adverse events (AEs), Risk factors and drug utilization of Buscapina Compositum N in adults from metropolitan lima
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All patients were screened for eligibility to participate in the trial. Patients attended one of 4 specialist sites which ensured that they met all strictly implemented inclusion/exclusion criteria. Patients were not to be entered to trial treatment if any one of the specific entry criteria was violated.

group.title: Buscapina Compositum N
group.description: Combination of 10 milligram (mg) of hyoscine n-butylbromide (HBB) and 500 mg of paracetamol. The dose of Buscapina Compositum N was according to label instructions which patients had to acquire on their own (one to two tablets by mouth every 8 hours for 3 to 4 days, swallowed whole with sufficient water).

baseline.population: Patients who have received at least one dose of Buscapina Compositum N according to label indications and who attended to one of the health centers selected for the study.

group.title: Buscapina Compositum N
group.description: Combination of 10 milligram (mg) of hyoscine n-butylbromide (HBB) and 500 mg of paracetamol. The dose of Buscapina Compositum N was according to label instructions which patients had to acquire on their own (one to two tablets by mouth every 8 hours for 3 to 4 days, swallowed whole with sufficient water).

reported_events.time_frame: From the initial dose of study drug until end of the follow up period, up to 113 days
reported_events.desc: During the observational period, all adverse events following exposure to Buscapina Compositum N were recorded in the case report form, regardless of seriousness or causality.

group.title: Buscapina Compositum N
group.description: Combination of 10 milligram (mg) of hyoscine n-butylbromide (HBB) and 500 mg of paracetamol. The dose of Buscapina Compositum N was according to label instructions which patients had to acquire on their own (one to two tablets by mouth every 8 hours for 3 to 4 days, swallowed whole with sufficient water).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Since the study is conducted at some health centers, it cannot be generalized to the whole population who uses study drug. It is without a control group, thus not able to compare cumulative incidence of AE with the patients not exposed to this drug
